genresAdvancedInfo.name: german romanticism
genresAdvancedInfo.description: German Romanticism is a movement in the arts and literature that emerged in Germany in the late 18th and early 19th centuries. It is characterized by a focus on emotion, nature, and individualism, and is often associated with the works of poets and writers such as Johann Wolfgang von Goethe and Friedrich Schiller. In music, German Romanticism is characterized by its use of lush harmonies, expressive melodies, and a focus on the emotional content of the music.
